result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Richard Hands

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joshua Richard Hands not in court, in custody.  Attorney Tedia K. Gamino appeared by video for Joshua Richard Hands.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for status conference. Court waives defendant's appearance. State is in compliance with victim notification.
Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests additional time to review. 
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 15.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joshua Richard Hands not in court, in custody.  Attorney Tedia K. Gamino appeared by video for Joshua Richard Hands.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held off the record due to no court reporter availability. State is in compliance with victim notification. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 15 via Zoom.
Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Court ordered no contact with Terence H.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Joshua Richard Hands in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Joshua Richard Hands in custody.  Sara Beth Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge J.D. Watts, Branch 15.   Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
